examples.igbo: Ụmụ akwụkwọ niile nọ ebe a.

examples.english: All the books are on the table.
Many people came to the party.
examples.igbo: Ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ bịara oriri na ọṅụṅụ.

examples.english: There are many stars in the sky.
examples.igbo: Enwere ọtụtụ kpakpando na mbara igwe.

examples.english: Some of the apples are ripe.

examples.igbo: Ọ bụ mmadụ ole na ole bịara nzukọ ahụ.
Ụmụ akwụkwọ ole na ole gafere ule ahụ.

examples.english: The other book is on the shelf.
examples.igbo: Akwụkwọ nke ọzọ dị na shelf.

examples.english: She has other plans for the weekend.
examples.igbo: O nwere atụmatụ ndị ọzọ maka izu ụka.

examples.english: Do you have any other questions?
He lives in a big house.
He lives in a small apartment.

examples.igbo: E nwere ekele maka obere onyinye ahụ.
Àkwà mmiri dị warara dị ize ndụ.
Akpụkpọ ahụ dị gịrịgịrị na-esighi ike.

examples.english: The room is full of people.
examples.igbo: Ndị mmadụ juputara n'ọnụ ụlọ ahụ.

examples.english: The old tree is still standing.
The dull tool is hard to use.
examples.igbo: The dull ngwá ọrụ siri ike iji.

examples.english: The wet towel is on the floor.
The park is near my house.
examples.igbo: Ogige ntụrụndụ dị nso n'ụlọ m.
Ọ gara ebe dị anya site n’ụlọ ya.
Kedu ka ọ si arụ ọrụ?
Kedu ka i siri mee ya?

examples.english: If it rains, we will stay inside.
examples.igbo: Ọ bụrụ na mmiri zoo, anyị ga-anọ n'ime.

examples.english: If you come, I will be happy.
examples.igbo: Ị bịa, obi ga-adị m ụtọ.

examples.english: If he calls, let me know.
examples.igbo: Ọ bụrụ na ọ kpọọ, mee ka m mara.

examples.english: I am happy because you are here.
examples.igbo: Obi dị m ụtọ n'ihi na ị nọ ebe a.

examples.english: He left because it was late.
examples.igbo: Ọ hapụrụ n'ihi na oge eruola.

examples.english: She cried because she was sad.
examples.igbo: O bere ákwá n’ihi na o wutere ya.

examples.english: He is one of a kind.
Four chairs are in the room.
examples.igbo: Oche anọ dị n'ime ụlọ ahụ.

examples.english: Five apples are on the table.

examples.igbo: Ọ bụ nwoke nwere obi ike.

examples.english: The husband is fixing the car.
The mother is teaching her child.
The father is playing with his children.
examples.igbo: Nna ya na ụmụ ya na-egwuri egwu.
O nwere nkịta enyi na enyi.

examples.english: The dog is playing in the yard.
He found a louse in his hair.
The louse is hard to see.
He saw a snake in the garden.
He found a worm in the soil.
He got lost in the forest.
The forest is home to many animals.
He used a stick to draw in the sand.
The seed will grow into a tree.

examples.igbo: Akwụkwọ ahụ bụ akwụkwọ ndụ akwụkwọ ndụ.

examples.english: The leaf fell from the tree.
examples.igbo: Akwụkwọ ahụ si n'osisi ahụ daa.
Ahịhịa bụ akwụkwọ ndụ akwụkwọ ndụ.

examples.english: The grass is wet with dew.

examples.igbo: Akpụkpọ ahụ ya dị ire ụtọ.

examples.english: The blood flows through the veins.
The fat is used in cooking.
The fat is stored in the body.
The horn is used for decoration.
examples.igbo: A na-eji mpi ahụ chọọ mma.

examples.english: The tail wags when the dog is happy.
examples.igbo: Ọdụ ahụ na-ama jijiji mgbe nkịta nwere obi ụtọ.

examples.english: The feather helps the bird fly.
examples.igbo: Nku na-enyere nnụnụ aka ife efe.

examples.english: The mouth is used for eating.
The tooth is used for chewing.
The wing helps the bird fly.
examples.igbo: Nku na-enyere nnụnụ aka ife efe.

examples.english: He felt it in his guts.
The guts are essential for digestion.
She fed the baby with her breast.
examples.igbo: O ji ara ya nye nwa ahụ nri.
Ọ na-agba egwu na mmiri ozuzo.

examples.english: The river flows to the sea.
The sea is full of life.
He added salt to the soup.

examples.igbo: Nnu na-eme ka ụtọ ahụ dịkwuo mma.

examples.english: The dust settled on the furniture.

examples.igbo: O lere anya na mbara igwe.

examples.english: He felt the wind on his face.

examples.igbo: O jere ije n’ime igwe ojii.

examples.english: The smoke rises into the air.
The ash settled on the ground.
The road leads to the village.
The mountain is covered in snow.

examples.igbo: O yi uwe na-acha uhie uhie.
Ahịhịa bụ akwụkwọ ndụ akwụkwọ ndụ.
O tere mgbidi ahụ akwụkwọ ndụ akwụkwọ ndụ.
Akwụkwọ ndụ akwụkwọ ndụ dị ọhụrụ.

examples.english: The night sky is full of stars.

examples.igbo: Ọ na-arụ ọrụ maka otu ụlọ ọrụ.
Nke ahụ bụ ụgbọ ala ya.
Kedu mgbe bụ oriri na ọṅụṅụ?

examples.english: The party is at the park.
examples.igbo: Ememe ahụ dị na ogige ntụrụndụ.

examples.english: The book is in the bag.
examples.igbo: Akwụkwọ ahụ dị na akpa ahụ.
Ya na ndị enyi ya nọ.

examples.english: We are going to the party.
We are going to the party.

examples.igbo: Ọ gbụrụ ọnụ mmiri na tebụl.

examples.english: She breathed in the fresh air.

examples.igbo: Ha nụrụ ka nnụnụ na-abụ abụ.

examples.english: I think it is a good idea.
examples.igbo: Echere m na ọ bụ ezi echiche.
O chere na o ziri ezi.
Ha chere na ọ dị mkpa.

examples.english: I am afraid of the dark.
He is afraid of the snake.
They are afraid of the storm.
examples.igbo: Ha na-atụ egwu oké ifufe ahụ.
Ha mara onye e lekwasịrị anya n'ọkpụkpụ.
Ọ na-egwu mmiri n'ọdọ mmiri ahụ.

examples.english: He lay down on the grass.
She lay down on the bed.
They lay down on the floor.
He gave the book to her.
She gave the gift to him.
They gave the money to the charity.
examples.igbo: Ha nyere ndị ọrụ ebere ego ahụ.

examples.english: He rubbed the lotion on his skin.
examples.igbo: Ọ kụra ude ahụ n’akpụkpọ ahụ́ ya.

examples.english: She rubbed the oil on her hair.
examples.igbo: O were mmanụ na ntutu isi ya.

examples.english: They rubbed the dirt off the car.
examples.igbo: Ha kpochapuru unyi n'ime ụgbọ ala ahụ.

examples.english: The boat floated on the water.
examples.igbo: Ụgbọ mmiri ahụ na-ese n'elu mmiri.

examples.english: The leaf floated on the river.
examples.igbo: Akwụkwọ ahụ sere n'elu osimiri ahụ.

examples.english: The balloon floated in the sky.
examples.igbo: Balloon ahụ sere n'elu n'elu igwe.

examples.english: The river flowed through the valley.
examples.igbo: Osimiri ahụ si na ndagwurugwu ahụ gafee.

examples.english: The water flowed into the lake.
examples.igbo: Mmiri ahụ na-asọba n'ime ọdọ mmiri ahụ.

examples.english: The oil flowed into the bottle.
The water froze in the winter.
The ice froze in the freezer.
The water swelled in the river.
The flower swelled in the sun.
The dough swelled in the oven.
examples.igbo: Ntụ ọka ahụ zara na oven.
